title: As a Hindu, what religious book do you read daily? - Quora

response.answer_text: Reading religious book increases prosperity,fortune,brings one closer to God and give internal strength . As a Hindu I read the following books daily and the output of this makes my whole day full of happiness. The religious book which I read are as follows Durga Chalisa If one read Durga chalisa daily it helps one to be joyous through out the life and the person will win over enemies 2) Ganesh Atharvashishra  Lord Ganesh is the first God to be worshipped during pooja and Atharvashishra helps one to free from all hurdles and Lord Ganesh will give alot of new opportunities to succeed in life to the person who read Atharvashishra daily. 3)Shiv tandav stotram This stotram was written by Ravana and this stotram makes Lord Shiva shower love ,wealth to his / her devotees. This stotram is full of praise of Lord Shiva. I grab this book from Mypustak.com at free of cost.Shiv tandav stotram also fulfill the dreams of the devotees who chant this stotram consistently.  4) Hanuman chalisa We all know that lord Hanuman is present in kalyug and whoesever read Hanuman Chalisa daily fill be free from all evil spirit and Hanuman will give one alot of Strength, Knowledge and success who read Hanuman Chalisa read atleast for 100 times.I hope the religious book suggested by me may influence one to read to develop spirituality.

Ramcharit Manas, Hanuman Chalisa and Shrimad Bhagwad Gita are still found in almost every household. Elderly people used to rrad them regularly.The young generation has little time, knowledge, patience or inclination.  I have read a few books on religion, but am not a regular reader. Thankfully no particular book has ever been thrust upon us by our religion and one is free to read any, many or none at all.
